did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
Cornell University Statutory College Survey Reports,
1928
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: A series of reports on the statutory colleges of Cornell University, completed for the New York State Department of Education in 1928.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Cornell University is the land grant institution for New York State. The University was founded in 1865, and much of its original land and endowment came from the Morrill Land Grant Act. In subsequent years, the State Legislature established four statutory colleges at Cornell: Veterinary Medicine in 1894; Agriculture in 1904; Home Economics (now Human Ecology) in 1924; and Industrial and Labor Relations in 1944. While the statutory colleges are affiliated with the State University system and receive state funding , they are not state-run.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: A series of reports on the statutory colleges of Cornell University, completed for the New York State Department of Education in 1928. The statutory colleges during this period included the College of Agriculture, the College of Home Economics, and the New York State College of Veterinary Medicine. The New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva was also a statutory unit. The individual reports were written by Edwin West Allen, E. T. Ashbaugh, Fred Englehart, Edward Lord, Albert Russell Mann, E. T. Perine, and Harlan Updegraff.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University. College of Home Economics.
New York State Agricultural Experiment Station.
New York State College of Veterinary Medicine
New York State Department of Education.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell University Statutory College Survey Reports, #55-02-3314. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: "The Survey of the State Colleges of Agriculture and Home Economics and the State Agricultural Experiment Station: Report on Action Taken on Proposals Therein," by A. R. Mann.
"Survey of Resident Teaching and Administration at State College of Agriculture at Cornell University," by Harlan Updegraff.
"Research in the State Institutions under Cornell University," by E. W. Allen.
"Report on New York State Colleges of Agriculture and Home Economics at Cornell University, New York State Veterinary College, and Agricultural Experiment Station, Geneva," by E. T. Perine.
"A Survey of the Plant of the State Colleges at Cornell University," by Fred Englehart.
"A Survey of the Heat, Light, Power, and Water Utilized at the State Colleges at Cornell University," by Edward Lord.
"A Survey of the Extension Services of the New York State Colleges of Agriculture and Home Economics," by E. T. Ashbaugh.
